TopicTitle: Zooming in to celestial body is set to go untill it's ref point allowing camera to go inside 3D model of a body

Articles.Content:
Hey there,

Zooming in to any celestial body (planet or moon) in map view with said body "focused", allows camera zoom to go all the way down to reference point (center) of said celestial body resulting in camera going into 3D model of the body and producing flipped normals visual effects. I believe, as in KSP1 zoom capability of a camera should be limited to CelestialBodyRadius + SomeDistanceAtWhichAtmosphericsStillLookOkay. So for instance if a body has radius of 50km, it can be == 50 + 10 == 60km
